short_summary: Supplier must be recognized by their community as an Elder/Cultural Advisor within that community. Supplier must have a minimum of five (5) years of experience in delivering spiritual and cultural services and teachings to Indigenous people.
description: The Correctional Service of Canada (CSC) is seeking a supplier to provide Elder services to meet the reintegration needs of Indigenous offenders. • The supplier must be recognized as an Elder by their community, meaning they are a person who has knowledge and understanding of traditional Indigenous culture, is in touch with community norms and expectations, and has the ability to draw from their traditional Indigenous knowledge and perspective. • The supplier must have a minimum of five years of experience in delivering spiritual and cultural services to Indigenous people. The proposed project must administer in accordance with the following Technical Requirements. Communication – The Client will be notified of progress and results through regular and formal meetings with the Supplier, submitted activity reports, and deliverables. The supplier may use a mix of methods to communicate the results, such as emails, corporeal reports. Finally, the funds from the provision of the services will go for hiring facilitator and a communications officer, along the amount spent for compensation, housing and transport for above services mentioned above.
